# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a concise implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)::String
    lines, current_line = [], ""
    for word in split(text)
        if !isempty(current_line) && (length(current_line) + 1 + length(word)) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= isempty(current_line) ? word : " " * word
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)  # add the last line
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage
text = "Julia is fast and elegant, combining the benefits of both low-level and high-level programming languages."
println(wrap_string(text, text_width=15))
```

This will output:
```
Julia is fast
and elegant,
combining the
benefits of
both low-level
and high-level
programming
languages.
```
